address: Xã Tân Long, Thị xã Ngã Năm, Tỉnh Sóc Trăng
thought:
**My Analysis of the Administrative Reorganization**

Okay, so I'm tackling this administrative address conversion. The user's given me "Xã Tân Long, Thị xã Ngã Năm, Tỉnh Sóc Trăng," and my job is to pinpoint the new unit. This is pretty straightforward, but I need to be precise.

First, I broke down the old address: "Xã Tân Long" is the ward, "Thị xã Ngã Năm" is the district, and "Tỉnh Sóc Trăng" is the province.  I immediately thought about province mergers. Sure enough, resolution 60-NQ/TW states that Sóc Trăng was merged into Cần Thơ. That's a key piece of information. So, right off the bat, I know the new province name will be "Thành phố Cần Thơ."

Next, I delved into the provided resolutions to look for "Xã Tân Long" and "Thị xã Ngã Năm". I checked a few, focusing on those relevant to Sóc Trăng. I started with 1663/NQ-UBTVQH15, but it was for Đồng Tháp, which isn't the right area, even though it mentioned a "xã Tân Long". Then, I hit 1668/NQ-UBTVQH15. Bingo! This one focused on Cần Thơ, my target area. It mentioned "Thị xã Ngã Năm" which is critical.

I noted that "phường Ngã Năm" was created by combining existing units, but "Xã Tân Long" wasn't explicitly listed as being part of that. Similarly, "phường Mỹ Quới" was also created from some wards within "Thị xã Ngã Năm". Unfortunately, my search hasn't yielded a direct replacement for "Xã Tân Long." I'll need to explore whether it's been consolidated into a different unit, or whether the user's initial address information is incomplete or inaccurate. My investigation continues, but I've made some good headway.

citation.header: 60-NQ/TW: Các đơn vị hành chính cấp tỉnh mới sau sáp nhập, hợp nhất
citation.line: 19. Hợp nhất thành phố cần Thơ, tỉnh Sóc Trăng và tỉnh Hậu Giang; lấy tên là thành phố Cần Thơ
